project_descrip: Short: EMERGENCY DISASTER DAMAGE REHABILITATION PROJECT Long: Rural Infrastructure Works: This components provides for the rehabilitation and restoration of rural infrastructure in 23 districts, including ,a) 3,000 km of rural roads, and, b)9 km of bridges and culverts. Improved slope protection works at vulnerable points and provision of additional drainage facilities will provide preventive measures for future flood damage. In addition the component will also cover the construction  and/or repair of flood and cyclone shelters (including livestock shelters) with sanitary facilities to protect poor communities during future floods and cyclones. Municipal Infrastructure Works: This components will rehabilitate urban infrastructure in 30 municipalities, this includes, a) 700 km of roads , b) 65 km of drains, and, c) 850 meters of bridges, culverts, and footpaths.Road Works: This includes the rehabilitation of 800 km of damaged national, regional, and district roads as well as 64 bridges and culverts within the country's seven road zones. Water Resources Component: This component will finance the following works in 47 districts, a) rehabilitation of flood control, drainage, and irrigation facilities, b) repair of  embankment breaches, and, c) repair or replacement of water control structures and canals.
longdescription: Rural Infrastructure Works: This components provides for the rehabilitation and restoration of rural infrastructure in 23 districts, including ,a) 3,000 km of rural roads, and, b)9 km of bridges and culverts. Improved slope protection works at vulnerable points and provision of additional drainage facilities will provide preventive measures for future flood damage. In addition the component will also cover the construction  and/or repair of flood and cyclone shelters (including livestock shelters) with sanitary facilities to protect poor communities during future floods and cyclones. Municipal Infrastructure Works: This components will rehabilitate urban infrastructure in 30 municipalities, this includes, a) 700 km of roads , b) 65 km of drains, and, c) 850 meters of bridges, culverts, and footpaths.Road Works: This includes the rehabilitation of 800 km of damaged national, regional, and district roads as well as 64 bridges and culverts within the country's seven road zones. Water Resources Component: This component will finance the following works in 47 districts, a) rehabilitation of flood control, drainage, and irrigation facilities, b) repair of  embankment breaches, and, c) repair or replacement of water control structures and canals.

project_descrip: Short: SUSTAINABLE RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT Long: Project is to reduce rural poverty by: 1) developing capacity within village groups to become involved in decision making process including a Community Investment Fund, 2) land tenure enhancement, 3) developing watersheds and irrigation schemes to reverse degradation of cultivated and non cultivated land, 4) increasing revenues of rural poor by raising agricultural yields and value of agricultural products as well as job generation, 5) raising population's standard of living through access to social services and markets, and 6) project management.
longdescription: Project is to reduce rural poverty by: 1) developing capacity within village groups to become involved in decision making process including a Community Investment Fund, 2) land tenure enhancement, 3) developing watersheds and irrigation schemes to reverse degradation of cultivated and non cultivated land, 4) increasing revenues of rural poor by raising agricultural yields and value of agricultural products as well as job generation, 5) raising population's standard of living through access to social services and markets, and 6) project management.

project_descrip: Short: SAMENDENI VALLEY INTEGRATED DEVELOPMENT PROJECT Long: The main objective of the project is to improve agricultural production in the Samendeni valley through the construction of a dam to store irrigation water and to reform 1,500 ha over a period of 20 years. It will also provide the city of Bobo-Dioulasso with potable drinking water.

project_descrip: Short: SOCIAL FUND II PROJECT Long: The project consists of sub-projects for the extension of social and economic infrastructure and services in specifically targeted areas throughout Cambodia. Project objectives will be realised through the following components: (a) Sub-Projects Social Fund II will provide grant financing to local Government units, NGOs, community groups and other entities to develop small scale infrastructure including rural roads, water supply and sanitation, irrigation schemes, communal clinics and schools. Financing will also cover provision of equipment and technical support, (b) Institutional Support Technical assistance will be extended to enhance institutional capacity in the Fund, its regional entities as well as local entities. The Fund's administrative costs will also be met by the project.
longdescription: The project consists of sub-projects for the extension of social and economic infrastructure and services in specifically targeted areas throughout Cambodia. Project objectives will be realised through the following components: (a) Sub-Projects Social Fund II will provide grant financing to local Government units, NGOs, community groups and other entities to develop small scale infrastructure including rural roads, water supply and sanitation, irrigation schemes, communal clinics and schools. Financing will also cover provision of equipment and technical support, (b) Institutional Support Technical assistance will be extended to enhance institutional capacity in the Fund, its regional entities as well as local entities. The Fund's administrative costs will also be met by the project.

project_descrip: Short: BAYIN RIVER MANAGEMENT PROJECT Long: This project will help develop Delingha City's river infrastructure so as to prevent the Bayin River from flooding, thus protecting the urban infrastructure and local industries, and enhancing the irrigation of downstream agricultural lands.
longdescription: This project will help develop Delingha City's river infrastructure so as to prevent the Bayin River from flooding, thus protecting the urban infrastructure and local industries, and enhancing the irrigation of downstream agricultural lands.

project_descrip: Short: BAYIN RIVER MANAGEMENT PROJECT Long: The overall objective of the project is to rehabilitate and sustain Delingha City's water resources and protect its urban infrastructure by preventing the Bayin River from flooding. This will: ensure the safety of the people and buildings on the riverbanks, enhance the irrigation of downstream agricultural lands by minimizing the effects of water erosion, as well as, increase the area of land suitable for industrial use, thus directly and indirectly creating more job opportunities for the people of Delingha. This will reduce costs associated with damage caused to the local infrastructure during the rainy season, increase agricultural production and income levels, thereby improving the overall standard of living of the local people and leading to sustainable social and economic growth.
longdescription: The overall objective of the project is to rehabilitate and sustain Delingha City's water resources and protect its urban infrastructure by preventing the Bayin River from flooding. This will: ensure the safety of the people and buildings on the riverbanks, enhance the irrigation of downstream agricultural lands by minimizing the effects of water erosion, as well as, increase the area of land suitable for industrial use, thus directly and indirectly creating more job opportunities for the people of Delingha. This will reduce costs associated with damage caused to the local infrastructure during the rainy season, increase agricultural production and income levels, thereby improving the overall standard of living of the local people and leading to sustainable social and economic growth.

project_descrip: Short: TELIMELE INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT Long: The project aims at improving the food security and living standards of the population of the province of Telimele through increased agricultural production and productivity , improved food self-sufficiency and also improved access to health care and education services.- More specifically, the project aims at improving and diversifying agricultural production and productivity through the development of small scale irrigation , lower lands development, intensification and diversification of crop and animal productions, processing and conservation of agricultural products, organizing and supporting farmer's organizations.The project would mainly consist of Development of rural infrastructure, Crop and animal production, Support to farmers organizations, Studies and Supervision and the setting-up of the PIU.

projecttitle: Efficient Land Management for Socio-Economic Enhancement in Southern Nepal (Phase II)
project_descrip: Short: EFFICIENT LAND MANAGEMENT FOR SOCIO-ECONOMIC ENHANCEMENT IN SOUTHERN NEPAL (PHASE II) Long: This project aimed to introduce the systematic cultivation of waste and fallow land and to improve the livelihood of marginalized women farmers in Southern Nepal. This was achieved through establishing and strengthening community-based groups, scaling up of promotion strategies for the mobilization of available local resources and create local level employment opportunities, Introduce systematic cultivation of waste and fallow land, Upgrade the skills of the target population based on improved technologies and introduce suitable crops and varieties for income generation, Establishing operational linkage between products and markets and strengthen marketing in an institutional manner. This project directly benefited 3,700 households, and in addition, indirectly 18,500 households in the region.The project has supported farmers to gain knowledge about efficient farming technologies and practices to improve irrigation and mobilize the unproductive land. Female farmers specifically have been provided with improved technical knowledge on irrigation and farming practices to maintain during in the dry season, which has enabled them to increase their agricultural yields. With increased income and production more job opportunities have been created in the Bara, Parsa, Makwanpur and Chitwan districts of Southern Nepal where urban migration is prevalent. These increased opportunities have prompted many men to return to the rural areas to work. Additionally, husbands have returned from the neighbouring cities in Nepal and India to work for their wives in the field. As well as providing financial relief for the families, this has empowered these traditionally marginalised women to gain greater respect within the communities.  Women, with the skills they have gained, have been driving growth for these rural areas. With support from this project women have been able to reduce their dependency on their husbands, pay off debt and provide quality health and education for their children.  The project support has directly affected the incomes of 3,670 household of marginal women. With improved capacity and access to markets, female farmers have improved the living conditions for themselves and their communities.
shortdescription: EFFICIENT LAND MANAGEMENT FOR SOCIO-ECONOMIC ENHANCEMENT IN SOUTHERN NEPAL (PHASE II)
longdescription: This project aimed to introduce the systematic cultivation of waste and fallow land and to improve the livelihood of marginalized women farmers in Southern Nepal. This was achieved through establishing and strengthening community-based groups, scaling up of promotion strategies for the mobilization of available local resources and create local level employment opportunities, Introduce systematic cultivation of waste and fallow land, Upgrade the skills of the target population based on improved technologies and introduce suitable crops and varieties for income generation, Establishing operational linkage between products and markets and strengthen marketing in an institutional manner. This project directly benefited 3,700 households, and in addition, indirectly 18,500 households in the region.The project has supported farmers to gain knowledge about efficient farming technologies and practices to improve irrigation and mobilize the unproductive land. Female farmers specifically have been provided with improved technical knowledge on irrigation and farming practices to maintain during in the dry season, which has enabled them to increase their agricultural yields. With increased income and production more job opportunities have been created in the Bara, Parsa, Makwanpur and Chitwan districts of Southern Nepal where urban migration is prevalent. These increased opportunities have prompted many men to return to the rural areas to work. Additionally, husbands have returned from the neighbouring cities in Nepal and India to work for their wives in the field. As well as providing financial relief for the families, this has empowered these traditionally marginalised women to gain greater respect within the communities.  Women, with the skills they have gained, have been driving growth for these rural areas. With support from this project women have been able to reduce their dependency on their husbands, pay off debt and provide quality health and education for their children.  The project support has directly affected the incomes of 3,670 household of marginal women. With improved capacity and access to markets, female farmers have improved the living conditions for themselves and their communities.

projecttitle: Poverty Reduction and Local Development Project
project_descrip: Short: POVERTY REDUCTION AND LOCAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT Long: PROJECT OBJECTIVES:The proposed project's chief objectives are to prevent further deterioration of the basic services provided for the country's poor population and to reinforce the operating capability of FISE to carry out additional small projects in the education, health and other priority areas promoting socio-economic development. Based on the positive experience gained with FISE in previous interventions, and the continuing extreme poverty problems faced by rural communities in Nicaragua, the Fund prepared this operation (fully administered by the Fund), consisting in the execution of Community Driven type of projects grouped into three main sectors: Education (rehabilitation and construction of schools), Health (rehabilitation and construction of health centers), Water and Sanitation reconstruction and rehabilitation and productive projects (mainly construction and rehabilitation of infraestructure supporting income generating activities).PROJECT AREA/LOCATION:The project activitieas are spread all over the country, focusing on the poorer communities. The project would be in part a follow-up of the OPEC Fund's/IDA's/IADB's earlier successful social investment fund projects, which have supported FISE in providing poverty-targeted, priority social and economic infrastructure, based on community demand and beneficiary participation.PROJECT COMPONENTS:   1.- Small-scale Projects (US$ 6.525 million)1.1 Rehabilitation/Construction of Schools1.2 Rehabilitation/Construction Health Care Units1.3 Rehabilitation/Construction of Sanitary Infrastructure1.4 Productive and Community Promotion (roads, small irrigation schemes, environmental protection).   2.- Strengthening of Local Capacity (US$ 0.300 millions)   3.- Project Management and Strengthening of FISE (US$ 0.675 million)
shortdescription: POVERTY REDUCTION AND LOCAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
longdescription: PROJECT OBJECTIVES:The proposed project's chief objectives are to prevent further deterioration of the basic services provided for the country's poor population and to reinforce the operating capability of FISE to carry out additional small projects in the education, health and other priority areas promoting socio-economic development. Based on the positive experience gained with FISE in previous interventions, and the continuing extreme poverty problems faced by rural communities in Nicaragua, the Fund prepared this operation (fully administered by the Fund), consisting in the execution of Community Driven type of projects grouped into three main sectors: Education (rehabilitation and construction of schools), Health (rehabilitation and construction of health centers), Water and Sanitation reconstruction and rehabilitation and productive projects (mainly construction and rehabilitation of infraestructure supporting income generating activities).PROJECT AREA/LOCATION:The project activitieas are spread all over the country, focusing on the poorer communities. The project would be in part a follow-up of the OPEC Fund's/IDA's/IADB's earlier successful social investment fund projects, which have supported FISE in providing poverty-targeted, priority social and economic infrastructure, based on community demand and beneficiary participation.PROJECT COMPONENTS:   1.- Small-scale Projects (US$ 6.525 million)1.1 Rehabilitation/Construction of Schools1.2 Rehabilitation/Construction Health Care Units1.3 Rehabilitation/Construction of Sanitary Infrastructure1.4 Productive and Community Promotion (roads, small irrigation schemes, environmental protection).   2.- Strengthening of Local Capacity (US$ 0.300 millions)   3.- Project Management and Strengthening of FISE (US$ 0.675 million)

projecttitle: Enhancing Food Security in the Gaza Strip
project_descrip: Short: ENHANCING FOOD SECURITY IN THE GAZA STRIP Long: This project will enhance food security via two components: 1) the rehabilitation of greenhouses, open fields, and irrigation systems as well as the provision of fertilizers and seedlings, 2) the strengthening of community based organizations and cooperatives through training and technical assistance. The project is expected to directly benefit 1,186 households.

projecttitle: Assistance to Civil Society Organizations in Gaza, Phase III: Air & Light Agricultural Development Association
project_descrip: Short: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN GAZA, PHASE III: AIR & LIGHT AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION Long: AAALD, established in 2003, aims at promoting solidarity between farmer families and achieving food security for poor families, through agricultural development projects. The grant is to support the project 'Open Land Reclamation and Seedlings Planting in the Khan Younis Governorate'. The main objective of the Project is (i) to rehabilitate 3,000 hectare of open land by building drip irrigation networks for seed plantings and (ii) to produce approximately 1,000 tons of different vegetables. In addition, the Project will support at least 300 farmers and their families by rehabilitating their farm structure and approximately 2,500 individuals to have access to fresh vegetables.
shortdescription: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN GAZA, PHASE III: AIR & LIGHT AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION
longdescription: AAALD, established in 2003, aims at promoting solidarity between farmer families and achieving food security for poor families, through agricultural development projects. The grant is to support the project 'Open Land Reclamation and Seedlings Planting in the Khan Younis Governorate'. The main objective of the Project is (i) to rehabilitate 3,000 hectare of open land by building drip irrigation networks for seed plantings and (ii) to produce approximately 1,000 tons of different vegetables. In addition, the Project will support at least 300 farmers and their families by rehabilitating their farm structure and approximately 2,500 individuals to have access to fresh vegetables.

projecttitle: Assistance to Civil Society Organizations in Gaza, Phase III: Agricultural Guiding and Awareness Society
project_descrip: Short: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN GAZA, PHASE III: AGRICULTURAL GUIDING AND AWARENESS SOCIETY Long: AGAS is a non-profit organization established in 2001, in Rafah, Gaza. AGAS focuses on agriculture aiming at improving the living conditions of farmers through the creation of jobs and reducing unemployment rates among farmers. The grant supported its project 'Greenhouses Renovation and Seedling Planting in Rafah City' including  the provision of 180,000 square meters of land with irrigation networks and seedlings to the farmers in Rafah, renovation of 150 greenhouses, construction of plastic sheets, creation of 240 job opportunities for poor families, provision of workshops and training courses to some 240 farmers.
shortdescription: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN GAZA, PHASE III: AGRICULTURAL GUIDING AND AWARENESS SOCIETY
longdescription: AGAS is a non-profit organization established in 2001, in Rafah, Gaza. AGAS focuses on agriculture aiming at improving the living conditions of farmers through the creation of jobs and reducing unemployment rates among farmers. The grant supported its project 'Greenhouses Renovation and Seedling Planting in Rafah City' including  the provision of 180,000 square meters of land with irrigation networks and seedlings to the farmers in Rafah, renovation of 150 greenhouses, construction of plastic sheets, creation of 240 job opportunities for poor families, provision of workshops and training courses to some 240 farmers.

projecttitle: Assistance to Civil Society Organizations in Gaza, Phase III: The Unity Association for Development
project_descrip: Short: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN GAZA, PHASE III: THE UNITY ASSOCIATION FOR DEVELOPMENT Long: UAD was established in 2000 working in the field of rural development, agriculture and women empowerment. UAD offers technical assistance and support along with the extension of services to individuals and organizations working in similar fields. The grant has been extended in support of its project 'Improving Farmers standard Living in Al-Shoka Village'. The project focused on reclaim land, provided 250 square meters with irrigation networks, and plant seedlings so as to achieve food security for some 1,700 individuals. In addition, approximately 280 job opportunities were created.
shortdescription: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN GAZA, PHASE III: THE UNITY ASSOCIATION FOR DEVELOPMENT
longdescription: UAD was established in 2000 working in the field of rural development, agriculture and women empowerment. UAD offers technical assistance and support along with the extension of services to individuals and organizations working in similar fields. The grant has been extended in support of its project 'Improving Farmers standard Living in Al-Shoka Village'. The project focused on reclaim land, provided 250 square meters with irrigation networks, and plant seedlings so as to achieve food security for some 1,700 individuals. In addition, approximately 280 job opportunities were created.

projecttitle: Assistance to Civil Society Organizations in Palestine (Phase III): Alistiqlal Center for Media and Development
project_descrip: Short: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN PALESTINE (PHASE III): ALISTIQLAL CENTER FOR MEDIA AND DEVELOPMENT Long: This project will provide wind energy system hybrid with an electric solar system to the existing farmers and shepherds. It will also introduce basic water supply infrastructure for irrigation and safe drinking water. The project will benefit 15 areas to become 15 small villages with some 920 inhabitants connected with short distances.  Each village will have one system.
shortdescription: ASSISTANCE TO CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS IN PALESTINE (PHASE III): ALISTIQLAL CENTER FOR MEDIA AND DEVELOPMENT
purposename: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
longdescription: This project will provide wind energy system hybrid with an electric solar system to the existing farmers and shepherds. It will also introduce basic water supply infrastructure for irrigation and safe drinking water. The project will benefit 15 areas to become 15 small villages with some 920 inhabitants connected with short distances.  Each village will have one system.

projecttitle: Assistance to Social and Development Projects in Palestine - Cooperative Association for Sustainable Agricultural Development
project_descrip: Short: ASSISTANCE TO SOCIAL AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN PALESTINE - COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION FOR SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT Long: The Cooperative Association for Sustainable Agricultural Development (CASAD) was established in 2006 in the Gaza Strip. Its mission is to improve the local farmers' living conditions. The grant has been extended to support the Provision of Equipment, Plantation, Irrigation and Capacity Building for Beekeepers.
shortdescription: ASSISTANCE TO SOCIAL AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN PALESTINE - COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION FOR SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT
longdescription: The Cooperative Association for Sustainable Agricultural Development (CASAD) was established in 2006 in the Gaza Strip. Its mission is to improve the local farmers' living conditions. The grant has been extended to support the Provision of Equipment, Plantation, Irrigation and Capacity Building for Beekeepers.

projecttitle: Medium Size Social and Development Projects in the Gaza Strip: National Association of Moderation and Development
project_descrip: Short: MEDIUM SIZE SOCIAL AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN THE GAZA STRIP: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MODERATION AND DEVELOPMENT Long: The National Association of Moderation and Development (NAMD) was founded in 2002 as a community based non-governmental not profitable charitable association which aims to provide social and cultural services to the Palestinian community across Palestine. The proposed project seeks to generate income through supporting farmers by land reclamation activities and irrigation systems, and aims at supporting the local economy by reducing unemployment and creating jobs, contributing to the development of local agriculture, improving agricultural outputs, generating income for poor farmers and their families, improve food industries that depend on the agricultural sector. The project will directly benefit 1,000 poor farmers.
shortdescription: MEDIUM SIZE SOCIAL AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN THE GAZA STRIP: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MODERATION AND DEVELOPMENT
longdescription: The National Association of Moderation and Development (NAMD) was founded in 2002 as a community based non-governmental not profitable charitable association which aims to provide social and cultural services to the Palestinian community across Palestine. The proposed project seeks to generate income through supporting farmers by land reclamation activities and irrigation systems, and aims at supporting the local economy by reducing unemployment and creating jobs, contributing to the development of local agriculture, improving agricultural outputs, generating income for poor farmers and their families, improve food industries that depend on the agricultural sector. The project will directly benefit 1,000 poor farmers.

projecttitle: Solar Electrification of Households and Education, Health and Water Facilities
project_descrip: Short: SOLAR ELECTRIFICATION OF HOUSEHOLDS AND EDUCATION, HEALTH AND WATER FACILITIES Long: The specific objective of the project is to demonstrate a decentralized renewable energy model for public private investment in rural electricity anchored to key rural economic drivers such as irrigation facilities/agro businesses and social service delivery. The project will directly benefit 10,000 persons in approximately 2800 households in the Gwanda South district of Zimbabwe.
shortdescription: SOLAR ELECTRIFICATION OF HOUSEHOLDS AND EDUCATION, HEALTH AND WATER FACILITIES
longdescription: The specific objective of the project is to demonstrate a decentralized renewable energy model for public private investment in rural electricity anchored to key rural economic drivers such as irrigation facilities/agro businesses and social service delivery. The project will directly benefit 10,000 persons in approximately 2800 households in the Gwanda South district of Zimbabwe.
